    HTTP/1.1 Digest Authentication - RFC 2617

      • serializeDigestResponse

        public static java.lang.String serializeDigestResponse(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paramMap)
        Serialize a parameter map into a digest response. This is used as the "Authorization" header in the request. All parameters in the supplied map will be added to the header.

      • parseDigestChallenge

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseDigestChallenge(java.lang.String headerValue)
        Parse a digest challenge from the WWW-Authenticate header return as the initial response during the authentication exchange.

      • generateCnonce

        public static java.lang.String generateCnonce(java.lang.String nonce,
                              java.lang.String nc)
        Generate the cnonce value. This allows the client provide a value used in the digest calculation. Same as Python. (no motivation given for this algorithm)

      • generateAuthorizationHeader

        public static java.lang.String generateAuthorizationHeader(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> digestChallenge,
                                           java.lang.String username,
                                           java.lang.String password)
        Generate the Authorization header to make the authenticated request.
